content.detailedDescription: We were on the beach for new years eve 2014 and looking at the stars when we saw a triangular red/orange lit object that eventually disappeared into thin air.
content.summary: See below

content.detailedDescription: Two lights bright orange were one on top the other in the sky about 32 degrees in the east sky in the east of burbank before the verdugo mountains.  lights faded and disappeared 4 minutes after midnight.
content.summary: Two lights bright orange were one on top the other in the sky about 32 degrees in the east sky in the east of burbank

content.detailedDescription:
My apologies for the shaky camera work, i shot this on my canon eos 1100d in video mode around 5am 1/1/2014. 

my girlfriend and i were sitting on the balcony and noticed a strange red glowing orb in the northern sky around 3am, the orb shot out a orange flash of light which is what caught our attention, i grabbed my camera but it wasn't any good capturing the object in the night sky. being curious we went out back with the camera to get a better view and noticed some more glowing orbs blue in colour zig zagging across the sky. we sat outside until 5am and saw about 13 of them over this period all moving in various directions across the sky. as the sun started to rise i finally could get some good video of these orbs that were hanging around, i took three videos in total. this one shows two orbs darting around, and the other shows a bell shaped object with four flashing colours. it was a lot clearer looking through the binoculars, i had a telescopic lens mounted on the 1100d which allowed me to get a good close up.

the best part is my girlfriend would give me crap about watching ufo hunters, (we have it on foxtel here in australia) and call me a ufo geek, now she has witnessed over a dozen in one go she is really freaked out.

check my videos i uploaded - [link moved to fi section/cms/tg]
content.summary: Multiple ufo's orbs sighted 1st jan starting 3am

content.detailedDescription: I went outside around 1155 and there were two steady red-orange lights slowly moving towards the east. watched them for about 30 seconds slowly move higher in the sky. then they fizzled out. then i saw two more rising up from the horizon so i ran inside to grab my boyfriend. those lights did the same thing as the other two; moving up out of the horizon, then start to dim and then finally completely disappear. we turn around and look towards west southwest? and there's a whole bunch more. like 5 or 6 close together. these ones seemed closer than the others. they kept popping up all over the skies and then disappearing. they were in every direction! oh and one of them began falling back towards the earth in sort of an erratic way. ... i can't see them being flares because they came from every direction until about 1225. it was scary yet exciting. that was so bizarre!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Red-orange starlike orbs in every direction moving slowly and disappearing

content.detailedDescription: Me and my wife were on our way home from her aunts to pop fireworks at home as we turned to get to the block before we get home we saw lights hovering slowly in the sky. we pulled over and saw it was like a fireball floating higher as another one appears from the treeline in front of us. another car pulled behind us and asked what it was and i said an alien lol. but we watched until they left! we then turned the block and parked home so my kids could do fireworks and that when more even closer started to emerge brighter and more! it looked like they were parked somewhere and we're taking off ass they were all doing the same and going the same direction . my neighbors also observed these fireballs hovering floating up ! it lasted for a good hour! it wasn't fireworks because i know and it wasn't a plane or heli either! it was a amazing!
content.summary: Hue ring moving flaming orb that looked as it was scanning with a light

content.detailedDescription: My partner lee and i were driving through melton, victoria. lee said " rob what is that up there? quick pull over" we got out of the car and saw a large star like object in the sky that was bright red\orange. we observed  it hovering side to side and up and down for several minutes then it seemed to turn, fade and simply disappear.
content.summary: Very bright, large glowing ball that looked like a red star but twice the size and moving in all directions then faded away to nothing.

content.detailedDescription: I'm a security guard who works the night shift from 2300-0700 in the west end of ottawa, on.I believe the sighting occured december 12, 2013. it was approximately 6 am and i decided to go out for a cigarrette. many employees were showing up for work at this time. i proceeded out the east entrance and turned right walking south toward the smoking area. i'm an amateur astronomer and study astrophysics so i'm always looking up to see whats going on up there. as i approached the smoking area i witnessed what appeared to be 3 star-like lights appear in the southern sky. my head was tilted a bit so i'm guessing it was around 60 to 70 degrees above the horizon. obviously these star like lights were not stars, but with a quick glance one might mistake the 3 lights for stars. the 3 star-like lights were travelling in unison and appeared to be same distance from each other. they seemed to enter our orbit for about 6 seconds before they instanty disappeared. when i first spotted the 3 star like objects entering the earth's orbit a lady having a smoke who just arrived for her work day looked at me and said what is that you are looking at. i responded that i thought it may have been the international space station, although i have seen the internatinal space station from ground level and this was totally different. i told her i'm really not sure so i'm classifying it as a ufo. i have also viewed comets, meteors, satellites, and several other objects in space from ground level. this was something different entirely. the magnitude of the brightness of the 3 objects was incredible. as said before they appeared to be brightly shining stars, but were definately not stars. the 3 bright star-like objects were travelling in unison extremely fast and in a straight line parallel to the horizon. the objects were not in triangle formation. they were in a straight line formation perpendicular to the horizon. i lost sight of the objects or object as it/they left our orbit. i believe it could have been a spacecraft using the slingshot technique around the earth, but unfortunately i definately cannot prove this to be true. this area of the sky seems to be very active as i have seen many unusual events happen including what appeared to be a star exploding back on june 10, 2013. on this day june 10, 2013 something instantaneously brightened to about the size of the moon then disappeared within seconds leaving nothing behind except the blackness of space. is it a coicidence that this event occurred at the same time i was abondoning a scientific report i was writing on gobekli tepe. this event gave me the inspiration and motivation needed to write a 90 page scientific report on the archeological site called gobekli tepe. i'm not quite sure what i viewed on december 12, 2013 but my expertise in this field leads me to believe it was not natural and not a man-made object. therefore, i'm writing this sighting in hopes that someone may be able to shed some light on this event. as stated before i lost sight of the 3 star-like object/objects as they disappeared which i believe was caused due to the objects/object exiting our orbit. thank you and hope that this helps out in someway. matthew c. simms
content.summary: 3 star like objects travelling in unison entered our orbit for 6 seconds then disappeared as quick as they appeared

content.detailedDescription: Only glowing objects the first of which from the east sharp turn to noortheast and very bright followed by several reddish objects headed northwest all in about a 20 minute timeframe..I was letting the dogs out before bedtime..Feeling of unknown not scared but kind of scared first object stayed glowing until out of sight other objects went dark as they approached
content.summary: Just after 12am on 1/1/2014 a very bright reddish orb flew towar me from the east changed to a north east direction sharply this was followed by several reddish objects headed northeast and the latter objects dimmed until light gone

content.detailedDescription:
Went outside because of fireworks. didnt see any just heard booms. then all of a sudden this orange red started moving back and forth then lowered and rose up. looked like grey parachute type things falling.  

video taken is on camera. will have to download tomorrow and send. i am filling this out on my cell phone.
content.summary: Bright red orange flashing wavering light

content.detailedDescription: I was out watching the fireworks on new years eve when i saw what i thought was burning embers from a firework drifting in the sky. but then more of these embers starting coming up out of the tree line. 7 of these orange glowing crafts drifted over my house and flickered out after about 5 minutes.
content.summary: 7 ufos on new years eve

content.detailedDescription:
We were driving home from dinner at approx. 9:10pm on dec 31, 2013.  i am a non drinker and so is my husband.  we had an additional passenger in the vehicle at the time that also witnessed these orange/red balls in the sky.  i happened to have a camera and since these looked so weird and the fact that there was no noise and some were remaining in place and others were moving at a slow rate of speed in an easterly direction.  one appeared to get very close to another and while watching that one, some of the other ones vanished.   i obtained several pictures with a sony 30x optical zoom camera.   when you see these pictures some appear to be perfectly round.  two of the pictures when zoomed in on my screen appear to have something in the middle of them that sure as hell looks like something out of a space movie.  i'm not on drugs and all of us saw the same thing.  i don't wear contacts or glasses and am not impaired in any way.    i can submit these pictures in full resolution if you care to see them.  this is rather bold on my part because i don't want to be called crazy.    we were on hood canal when this happened and we're not all that far from bangor nuclear sub facility.  these lights were directly over land and not water.  not one sound could be heard and it was perfectly dark because we live in a very rural area.  when they moved, they weren't moving in odd directions and were moving slowly towards the hood canal or toward each other.    since we were on our way home and since we were the designated drivers, we left after around 10 minutes to deliver our passenger home.  i have attempted to see these in the valley that i live but there is nothing visible.  frankly, this really had me wondering what the hell i saw - especially when you zoom in on the two pictures that show something inside the orange/red sphere.   

i'm more than willing to submit the pictures... i took (a total of 9) but these were taken at high resolution and my internet speed doesn't allow for anything faster than 1.5m so to send the 35.1mb file would take a bit of time.   i will send three of the ones that i took.  two show something inside the orb.  just zoom in and see what we saw.  the other one shows how perfectly round the orb is.  these were taken with almost a full 30x zoom.     i hope that this is a legitimate site because i'm sticking my neck out providing this information without assurances that i won't be the subject of some sort of ridicule.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Driving south on highway 101 at approx 9:10pm 12/31/13 witnessed first 2 then 5 round orange red orbs

content.detailedDescription: Walked outside the front door, looked up in the sky and seen what we thought was an airplane on fire.  it was triangular in shape and had a reddish glow and at times the glow was red/orange. the path the craft made was straight but it would hover or bounce up and down along the path.  as it got closer to the house there was no typical airplane sound when it went over the house, it was quiet and simply glowing and hovering.  then the craft started to go up in elevation.  we continued to watch the craft and then it suddenly vanished from the sky.  it was december 31st at 11:58pm. we watched it for almost 2 minutes until it vanished.  (we went outside because it was almost time to yell happy new year and saw the weird triangular craft hovering in the sky).  we were fascinated by the glow and shape and then it simply disappeared before our eyes. i just hope i do not get abducted by aliens to start my 2014 :)
content.summary: Glowing red/orange triangular

content.detailedDescription:
Your site is ridiculous! for an ipad, anyway-"required, required, required"!
i used my camera on my ipad too run off  18 images of two (identical)  objects in a row,..I can't tell which ones were uploaded to your site,--though i went through my images & wrote down the "photo number" of the "best ones"--i can't tell one from the other when trying to upload to your site, but more than a few came out rather "defined" on the ipad
you're welcome to contact me (or not)- i can only reply/call back after business hours/early evening.
content.summary: Two bright orange-colored "disk-like" shapes. -photos show what looks more triangular

content.detailedDescription: We went out to our backyard to watch the new year's fest fireworks; we live less than 2 miles from the downtown of kalamazoo; it was about 15 degrees temperature and snowing steadily.  i became aware of 5-6 orange pulsing orbs moving into view from the south, hovering over the trees between us and the downtown area. we raced out into the field behind our house to see more clearly. the orbs, in turn, gradually seemed to go up and disappear into the low clouds and snow; meanwhile we became aware of another orb slowly coming from the same area of the south, and then another, and another, all following approximately the same path, from the s to the se, hovering in the same general area of the sky over the neighborhood between us and downtown, about 25-30 degrees above our visible horizon.  it took about 20 minutes overall, and we saw/counted 19 orbs.  they at times got close to each other as they hovered, and one by one slowly disappeared up into the cloud cover.  i did hear jets going by a couple of times, and at first thought that maybe the first ones might have been aircraft; but the jets that i heard were above the clouds and moved from north to south (by sound); the orbs had no sound and traveled from s to se.  they glowed and pulsed from an orange-red to a creamy color.  we were amazed to see so many, coming in a rather regular pattern and timing.  even more amazingly, last year we also went outside to watch the fireworks on new years night and also saw orbs - last year there were three, they were closer to us, the night was more clear (low clouds but not snowing), and the orbs were deeper red; they also gradually ascended up into the cloud cover.  we have wondered, only half kiddingly, if they are hanging around to watch the fireworks!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: We went outside at 12 to watch the new years fireworks. we saw a succession of at least 19 orange pulsing orbs slowly move from s to se, hovering, changing positions, ascending, disappearing into the snowy sky.

content.detailedDescription: Just got done barbecuing for new years eve (i don't drink).  looked up in sky and saw many stars for a los angeles night.  something caught my eye and it was a large orange light, larger and brighter than any star.  it was moving very slowly about 35 degrees on the horizon from the east by southeast towards the west by northwest.  it looked like an airplane on fire but it trailed no flames and seemed to stay the same orange color. it stayed the same color, speed and direction.  after watching it move very slowly for 3 to 4 minutes, it seemed to slow down, bright orange color became dull, appeared to hover for a few seconds and disappeared.  there seems to be a very tiny white light left but i think it was a distant star. i looked away and could not refind the tiny white light.  my roommate saw the same thing and had no idea what he saw.  i have always loved airplanes, know them very well, and have seen many meteorites.  i have been in aerospace quality for 44 years and been to many west coast airshows. my first thought was that it was a 737 on fire but no particles, fire trail, no anything trailing. with all the years i have watched the skies, i have never seen anything like this.  if it was a meteor, it was headed right at me as it had no tail, no sparks, and appeared to be going very slow.
content.summary: Orange object appeared like a plane on fire but no trail. the became dull and faded away.

content.detailedDescription: Standing outside and looked up at a huge cloud, one of the biggest i've seen in a long time, and noticed a light moving through the cloud at a fast pace, then noticed two other lights. they didnt cast any light outside of the cloud towards the ground or in any direction outside of the cloud. this has lasted for over 30 minutes and the lights always stay inside the cloud and move with the cloud.
content.summary: Three round lights were moving very fast inside of a large cloud and are still moving along with the cloud heading southeast...Never leaves the cloud

content.detailedDescription: New years eve two friends and i  went onto the upper deck of the house to watch the fireworks across the lake.  looking away from the fireworks and towards the west i spotted the bright orange light in the sky.  i quickly pointed it out to my friends (i had seen one in november but had not reported it to mufon) and asked them" what is that? ive seen one of those before!" there are no normal blinking plane lights, we are very near an airport and a military base and we are used to seeing those and it is far too bright to be a chinese lantern, no way its a flare either. my friends are also acquainted with military craft and tried to logically explain it. "maybe its mars?"  "no. its moving."  we stared at it as it slowly moved and then the light quickly faded to a pinpoint and disappeared. i told them about how there have been sightings of these being reported and showed them proof on the internet. we are not saying it is extra terrestrial, we have no idea. we are just saying it is and unknown flying object  bright bright orange.
content.summary: Bright orange pulsing orb in sky appearing to travel slowly westward then slowly fade from view

content.detailedDescription:
On exactly midnight on new years, i saw a ufo rise above houses as i was facing the west. i thought it was a firework, and when it didn't explode as i expected, it continued to rise and get smaller. i noticed another ufo above it, and it was flying away. the first ufo i saw started to follow it and then the ufo it was following disappeared, and the ufo moved east and kept ascending until it looked like a pin in the sky. 
about an hour before i saw the ufo my father was facing east towards nj and he saw the orange/red light (exactly as i saw it) move across the sky and blink, disappear for a second, then he saw it again until he couldn't see it anymore because it got too small.
content.summary: My dad and i saw a ufo at separate times in separate places in the same night

content.detailedDescription: Walked outside at 2 minutes past new years to let the my boys hear there very first new years gunfire celebration and to shoot off 4 shotgun shells, one for each family member. as we walked into the back yard i noticed a very bright red pulsating object hanging stationary in the sky at approx 30 degrees above the horizon in the east. at first i thought it must be a plane as we live directly under a flight path for large commercial planes. it was then that i noticed an actual plane on the normal flightpath approaching from the north east at a very high altitude and a distance of several miles. the object in question appeared further east and lower than the flight path. mt wife and my 2 sons ages 8 and 7 witnessed the object and the plane. we commented how strange it was and were able to see the object for at least a minute possibly longer. i turned to my wife to speak to her for just second and when i turned back to the light it was gone. there was no sound. the weather hear was hazy to slightly overcast but not enough to mask all the stars. north star was visible as well as a few others.None of were scared or had any strange feelings except that it was not a normal light in the sky.
content.summary: Very bright red pulsating stationary object that disapeared after approx 1 min

content.detailedDescription: Home with with wife and daughter on new years eve . minutes after the ball drop i looked out the front door and saw 3 red liights in the sky, moving slowly to  the west.Watched for several minutes then lights disappeared one at a time.
content.summary: Three red lights in the night sky . slowly moving west . disappeared one at a time.

content.detailedDescription: Went out side to take leak and saw three lights in typical pattern for final approach coming from the north, normally airliners are at 5,000 feet. the three lights coming south lined up like a heavy stack of planes doing there thing for final. they were "orange" like headlights on a car with bad electrical. weird! so i pondered (5 sec)... the air was still and no smell of fire place smoke to dim the lights. so i rushed in and got the binoculars (5 sec) and looked. focused in and out and no shape. it was a point of light (there were three). i concentrated on the closest one(aprox 10 sec). i was waiting to hear the sound of the jet as it passed over. there was none! the object was too high to be a chinese lantern. i rushed in and got the green laser [protection?/ what if, (5 sec)]. i looked around and saw two left. the third object (last in line) started to look separated from the airline pattern and changed direction as if it had control. it started to turn west. it faded shortly after. so i did the forbidden and decided to light it up. what ever it was it got tagged a couple of dozen of times. can't say for sure but it seemed to barely reflect. with in 5 sec it faded evenly with a very slight flicker. i continued to find it with the laser with no avail. these were with out a doubt not aircraft! silent and too high to be chinese lanterns. fyi too weird! my first with out doubt u f'n o.
content.summary: Mimicked fligjt path into sky harbor to point of fanal approach

content.detailedDescription: I awoke around 2:30am. i went to the window and observed a large object hovering over the neighborhood. the lights were mesmerizing and i couldnt stop watching it. it seemed to hover for a few minutes before moving towards my house & i was on the 2nd floor and it appeared to be several hundred feet above the house and it was quite large & a dull black or gun metal grey color with many lights around it in a boomerang type shape. they were not your typical aircraft lights. there was no sound. as it left my line of sight i went to another window in the house just in time to see it go up & quickly disappear. having lived in this area for over 50 years close to wpafb i have seen a lot of various aircraft. this was unfamiliar to me.
content.summary: I observed a large object off in the distance from the 2nd story of my home. it wasnt anything that i have seen before & i live close to wpafb.

content.detailedDescription:
After the new year fireworks we looked up at 12.20 am 1st jan 2014, we saw a bright star yellow orange not bright, it stood still, it moved few hundred feet, stood still, went up more and then moved like a shot and went out of sight

we were in a field near sliac slovakia, there were 5 of us 

we noticed it as it was getting bigger like a triangle we thought it was a lantern but its shape size movements standing still for 5 mintues
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Bright glow

content.detailedDescription: My son and i were upstairs watching videos xmas eve about 9pm. i was seated in front of the window. when my son turned to talk to me he exclaimed 'look out the window mom. what is that?' i turned at the urgency of the excitement in his voice. i had view to the south/southeast neighborhood across the street and observed 2 large orange lights moving over the 2 story homes heading what appeared to me southeastern direction. movement was very synchronized between the 2 lights, traveling same height and speed. i could not tell how far or what height but noticed how large the lights were and how i've never seen any aircraft that looked similar. i spun around to run downstairs to get a better look as the lights would be out of view from the window frame and i had to see this the best viewing possible. as i ran downstairs my son called out behind me "there are 3 lights now." i reached the front door and stepped out on my front porch and saw 3 lights now. the first 2 lights were closer together from each other then a greater distance between them and the 3rd light. all traveled same height and speed. as i stood watching the first lights seem to change course and took a more southern direction, the 3rd light followed suit. it seemed to me all 3 lights were connected to a larger mass even though it was dark. it moved very stealth like and completely silent. as i watched i tried to absorb as many details as possible. i even had a list of questions for myself such as "could i be watching flares? how about a jet, balloon, helicopter etc. all my answers were "no." even the color was quite unlike anything i've seen. i stared at the 3 orange round lights that seemed to flicker like fire inside a huge glass marble and very orange. not a solid orange light. it had some kind of life or energy inside the light. i yelled to my son to get my camera so i did get 43 seconds of video but at a distance regretfully. as it started to disappear behind the neighborhood horizon i had the thought to jump in my car and chase for better footage. but i then felt i had no need to which i find strange now. almost like it wasn't that big a deal. i'm kicking myself now. in closing, i would say my experience description matches those exactly of the "phoenix lights" observation of 1997.      sorry, i do not know how to attach video. i am not very computer savvy.
content.summary: 3 large orange lights traveling same speed/height

content.detailedDescription: 12-31-2013,630 p.M. arriving home i notice what at first look like a fireball. coming out of the west ,very high rate of speed,horizonally like a flight path,but wavering a bit, not a straight line.Visibly slowing to stationary position, holding about 10 to 20 seconds and then asending up, high rate of speed and disapering, immeditly after a second one appeared and did a repeat of above but got binoculars one this one. deffinitly a disc. glowing red/orange center mass with white/grey orb 360 degrees around it. i saw this coming from the west heading south east,basically the direction of the colorado river from needles to havasu, total event time about 3 min. 5 max. with witness and she got acouple cell phone pics. the surrounding orb was very intense,so bright in binocs it looked like a mini eclipse.And no orb when stationary.Very strange,it did not seem of this world.When it asended out of sight it seem to be because of rate of speed and distance covered so quickly, not vanish.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Fireball,   Oval,   Saturn-like,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Red/orange disc with white/grey orb surrounding it

content.detailedDescription: At or around 8:30 pm  on december 31 2013 me and my wife were driving home from dinner and as we turned off of chimney rock rd./hwy 64 east in edneyville onto gilliam mtn. road we noticed a larger than usual star shaped object in the sky. upon traveling directly towards the object on gilliam mtn. rd. (approximately 1/4 mile) we observed the object was pulsating and appeared to be on fire. the colors changed from bright orange to red and the object at times moved away from our location and would stop and hover. i'm not an aviator but would guess the objects altitude was between 5000 to 7000 feet as we could see the mountain on which we live and at its top is 3000 ft. we pulled in to a church parking lot and turned off our vehicle and got out. standing in the parking lot we witnessed the object pulsate red and orange in a fiery glow as it hovered then slowly start moving away then would stop again. there was absolutely no sound coming from the object however there were several other aircraft visible in the sky and they all had flashing red/white navigational lights and moved in a consistent straight flight path that one would expect from conventional aircraft. after about 5 minute of the object pulsating and making slow irregular movements (all the time moving away from our location) the object blinked in and out of sight maybe three times the object then completely disappeared. the weather was clear. i did have my phone w/ camera but knew that it was pointless to video the object as the resolution would have made the video unintelligible.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Pulsating fireball orb hovering in sky for 5 min. then blinked out.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving down the street and saw a weird  thing in the sky i called my bud devin and my phone lost sevice. a thing came down and i drove off
content.summary: Scary dark big

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing at oak st and washington waiting for the bus at the umn mpls campus, i happened to be looking in the sky watching the path a searchlight (belonging to the business across the street)was making in the clouds. i noticed a long perfectly straight line of light (that i'd guess) was about 50m long and 1m wide just above the cloud cover. i at first thought this might have been from a plane but discounted it when i watched it for about 15mins with no change in it's size or direction. 

what also struck me about this object was that whenever the searchlight passed over the line of light, there appeared to be a perpendicular reflection (like one would see if you were to shine a flashlight on a piece of metal). i watched this entire event for a good 15mins, and each time the searchlight passed over this spot i saw the perpendicular reflection. 

i did my best to take a video (but being that it was snowing and nighttime the only thing you are able to make out is the pulse of light that occurred when the spotlight passed over it.) it occurs at roughly the 10sec mark. sorry for the background noise from the nearby traffic and buses.
content.summary: Long light just above cloud cover reflected nearby spotlight on umn campus

content.detailedDescription:
Wife, son, and i were in our home and my wife was letting the cat in from outside and she noticed an orange ball of light in the sky. it would move from west to east and then west again. the light would go from bright to dim and then bright again. once i got my camera out to take a video the light lasted another 30 seconds or so before disappearing.

i will attach the video that was taken. i tried zooming in and out, which is the cause of the shakiness in the middle.

i tried taking pictures of the object, but the camera wouldn't focus.

we have seen these lights many times south of maricopa, az, but their usually more southwest of our home. this is the first time i saw them directly south of us.
content.summary: Orange ball of light hover then changes directions

content.detailedDescription:
My son and i were standing on the balcony in highlands ranch, co at around 6pm on june 12, 2012, when the three objects caught our eye. they were heading southeast at about 10mph in a triangle pattern for the most part.  just before the objects moved past the roof line of our residence, they stopped, hovered for about 30seconds, at which point the lowest left object (furthest away) extended what looked like a two segment "leg" which had a rear facing (northwest/west)declination. 

at this point, the objects began moving northwest.  the leg was now pointing southeast, so we assume they turned/rotated, as there was no arc to the direction change.  the objects then slowly moved across the sky and disappeared with remarkable acceleration. i was able to take a picture just before they accelerated out of sight.  

the objects more or less looked like they had a cylindrical shape over all, and although it is not evident in the picture, there was a lighter tone top section.  we could not see any blinking lights like those on virtually all aircraft i have observed.  sound travels very well in our area, yet there was absolutely zero noise from the objects, even as they accelerated out of view.

i searched the news, and the web for weeks/months, and even asked a family member who works at the sheriffs office if any reports had been filed. i brushed it off as just an anomaly, but it has bothered me for over a year, and looking at the picture today and realizing these things were pretty big, i felt that i should let someone know.  

as a note, we have a local airport about 6 miles away due east, and an air force base about 25 miles away to the northeast.  i love all kinds of aircraft, but have never seen a craft shaped like this before, nor has my son.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: My son and i observed three cylindrical objects heading southeast, then the objects stopped and headed northwest
